intro: Nemastylis latifolia subsp. heliantha, commonly known as the broadleaf nemastylis, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its compound leaves and umbel-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories or along stream banks. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, and it produces small, dry fruits known as schizocarps. The subspecies heliantha is distinguished by its broader leaves and more robust growth compared to other subspecies of Nemastylis.
